name: N-(3-chlorophenyl)-3,3,3-trifluoro-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4014
Reason: 3-chlorophenyl and trifluoromethyl functionalities can significantly increase the melting point due to the enhancement of the crystalline structure and the increase in molecular weight. The chlorine atom introduces a strong withdrawing group, which can increase the melting point by approximately +50 degrees Celsius. The trifluoromethyl group also introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. The phenyl group can also contribute to the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. The presence of three fluorine atoms can also increase the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and the rigidity of the structure, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius each.
